pr_title: [CALCITE-3868] Remove redundant ruleSet and ruleNames in VolcanoPlanner

timeline.message: [CALCITE-3868] Remove redundant ruleSet and ruleNames in VolcanoPlanner

timeline.bodyText: How should we validate the rule description pattern now ?
timeline.author: danny0405

timeline.bodyText: With this change the map becomes the main data structure holding the rules so I think the Javadoc should be updated to reflect this. Increasing the visibility of the field makes it public API; it might be better to keep this private and rely on public/protected methods to recover the necessary info.
timeline.author: zabetak

replies.bodyText: I think we may need to change it to LinkedHashMap to be consistent with the requirement of HepPlanner.
replies.author: hsyuan

replies.bodyText: It turns out we still need it to be protected to avoid copying.
replies.author: hsyuan

replies.bodyText: I think that in most cases the number of rules is not very big so I was thinking that copying vs. mapDescToRule.values() is not going to have significant performance overhead in the planning phase, thus, I tend to prefer better encapsulation. Having that said, I do not have any concrete measures to support my claims (just instinct that could be wrong) :)
replies.author: zabetak

replies.bodyText: I agree the rules is not very big. But in onNewClass, every time we add a new logical/physical operator we have to copy it. It will copy N times depends on how many operators you have. Though not a significant overhead, but I think we still need to avoid multiple times copy.
replies.author: hsyuan

replies.bodyText: I'm fine with any option so I am leaving the final decision up to you :)
replies.author: zabetak

timeline.bodyText: The method now basically registers the rule to the planner so it might be better to rename this entirely to addRule.
timeline.author: zabetak

timeline.bodyText: Rename this to removeRule and update the Javadoc?
timeline.author: zabetak

replies.bodyText: The parameter of this method is weird, should be string description of the rule, like removeRule(String desc) ?
replies.author: danny0405

timeline.bodyText: Would it be a good idea to move the method to AbstractRelOptPlanner? This would allow us to keep mapDescToRule private and replace calls to mapDescToRule.values() with calls to this method.
timeline.author: zabetak

timeline.bodyText: If we choose to add this method to the superclass (instead of having mapRuleDescription) then here we can ovverride.
timeline.author: zabetak

replies.bodyText: @zabetak I have addressed your comments. Thanks.
replies.author: hsyuan

timeline.bodyText:
If we already know the size of mapDescToRule, we can create a set with exact size, which will eliminate capacity expansion overhead and space waste when creating. Even though this is trivial update, I think it is always a good manner to create collection in such way if possible.
instruction.ruleSet = Sets.newHashSetWithExpectedSize(mapDescToRule.size());
timeline.author: neoremind

replies.bodyText: It turns out the size instruction.ruleSet is undetermined, we don't know the exact size. So I will leave as it is.
replies.author: hsyuan

replies.bodyText: I agree, there is "if" check to determine what to be added. I didn't find that out clearly, sorry about the false alert.
replies.author: neoremind
